gameplay

Class GameMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • gameplay.GameMain

  • public class GameMain
extends javafx.application.Application
    This class handles the game part of the application, it sets up the the game with variables, panes, buttons, layout and communication methods/threads for communicating with other players. All of the visual stuff is done here, and also some methods for handling the the visuals. When generated a object of this class, the object should call: "instancename".start(Stage). When calling this method, this Main method takes control of the Stage.
    See Also:
    Database, GameLogic

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage window)
        Start is called upon whenever the application changes scenes. Sets up variables, layouts, panes, buttons, etc. This method calls upon the addObstacles() method and the placementPhaseStart() method. the game in placementPhase
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        See Also:
        GameLogic, Application

      • updateResourceLabel

        public static void updateResourceLabel()

      • deselectRecruitTiles

        public static void deselectRecruitTiles()
        Deselects the other recruit tiles in the sidebar when selecting another recruit tile. This method unstrokes the recruitTiles which is not selected.
        See Also:
        Recruit, RecruitTile

      • changeDescriptionLabel

        public static void changeDescriptionLabel(java.lang.String newDescription,
                                          java.lang.String newDescriptionHead)
        Is a static method which sets the description used in the sidebar. It is used in Recruit, but can also be called from other Classes.
        Parameters:
        newDescription - Takes a String with the description that should show in the sidebar.
        newDescriptionHead - Takes a String for the description head.
        See Also:
        Recruit

      • descriptionVisible

        public static void descriptionVisible(boolean visible)
        Is a static method which controls if the description used in the sidebar is visible. It is used in Recruit, but can also be called from other Classes.
        Parameters:
        visible - Takes a boolean to control whether the description and description head is visible or not.

      • actualSurrender

        public void actualSurrender()
        This method is called upon by surrender() method, and this method uses the method surrenderGame() from the Database Class to send information about which player won, and increment games won for that player. It sets a variable surrendered=true, which is checked by another method after the end of each turn. This method ends the turn after setting the variable, and if it is not players turn then the method checks for game over using the checkForGameOver() method.
        See Also:
        Database

      • removePlaceUnitLabel

        public static void removePlaceUnitLabel()
        Method for removing placeUnitLabel and arrow after first unit is added to the board
        See Also:
        Tile

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Executes when application shuts down. User is logged out and database connection is closed. Calls on surrender method to show a message dialog to user that game ended before user is logged out.
        Overrides:
        stop in class javafx.application.Application

      • main

        public void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Calls for shutdown methods if program is closed. It is used to log out user and close connections.
        Parameters:
        args - Takes in arguemnts for the main method.
